decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to establish early board presence with aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Delver of Secrets, while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Abrupt Decay, Hymn to Tourach, and Force of Will. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and card selection/advantage engines such as Brainstorm and Sylvan Library. By combining efficient threats with disruptive elements, this BUG Midrange deck aims to control the game and outvalue its opponent. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Wasteland and Deathrite Shaman adds synergy and versatility to the deck.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and board while building up a strong board presence with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Deathrite Shaman, and Tarmogoyf. The deck also utilizes powerful removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Liliana of the Veil to control the board. With a mix of disruption, card advantage, and threats, this deck aims to apply consistent pressure on the opponent and outvalue them in the long run. Additionally, the deck relies on a strong mana denial strategy with cards like Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan with early disruption spells like Hymn to Tourach and Abrupt Decay, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Delver of Secrets. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and card advantage engines like Dark Confidant and Sylvan Library to maintain control of the game. With a flexible mana base and plenty of counterspells like Force of Will, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a proactive, aggressive manner.

This Legacy Aggro-Burn deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using cheap and efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide. The deck aims to pressure the opponent's life total early on and finish them off with powerful finishers like Fireblast and Sulfuric Vortex. With a low land count and a high density of burn spells, this deck prioritizes speed and direct damage to secure a swift victory. Additionally, cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel punish the opponent for playing spells, further increasing the pressure on them.

This Canadian Threshold deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent early in the game with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf, Nimble Mongoose, and Delver of Secrets. The deck also includes a suite of powerful countermagic spells like Force of Will, Daze, and Spell Pierce to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Spells like Lightning Bolt and Forked Bolt provide additional reach and removal, while cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Wasteland help to ensure the deck maintains consistency and control over the game. Overall, the deck aims to be proactive and disruptive, aiming to close out games quickly while staying ahead of the opponent.

This deck focuses on rapidly deploying a powerful board presence of Goblin creatures to overwhelm and quickly finish off the opponent. It utilizes cards like Goblin Lackey to cheat out bigger threats early, while also utilizing cards like Aether Vial and Goblin Warchief to ensure a steady stream of creatures hitting the battlefield. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Pyrokinesis to control the opponent's game plan while maintaining its aggressive strategy. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to pressure the opponent early and close out the game quickly with a swarm of Goblin attackers.

The main principle of this deck is to use the card "High Tide" to generate large amounts of mana, allowing for explosive combo plays involving cards like "Time Spiral" and "Turnabout" to draw cards and untap lands. The deck also includes counterspells like "Force of Will" and "Flusterstorm" to protect the combo, as well as card selection tools like "Brainstorm" and "Merchant Scroll" to find key pieces. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with mana and spells in order to win the game quickly and decisively.

The main concept of this Aggro Jund deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Hymn to Tourach and Thoughtseize, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Dark Confidant. The deck also utilizes powerful removal spells such as Abrupt Decay and Lightning Bolt to deal with threats, along with Punishing Fire for added reach. The mana base is designed to ensure consistency and enable the deck's game plan of grinding out value and overwhelming the opponent.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of land destruction and recursion, utilizing cards like Life from the Loam, Crop Rotation, and Punishing Fire to grind out opponents. It also has the potential to create a powerful 20/20 Marit Lage token by combining Thespian's Stage with Dark Depths. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's resources with Wasteland and Rishadan Port, while generating card advantage with Sylvan Library and Exploration. By controlling the board and managing resources effectively, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and secure the win.

The deck focuses on aggressive strategies with creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Knight of the Reliquary, supported by disruptive spells like Swords to Plowshares and Abrupt Decay. The deck also includes powerful equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice and Umezawa's Jitte to enhance the creatures' abilities. Green Sun's Zenith and Sylvan Library provide consistency and card advantage, while mana acceleration from cards like Noble Hierarch and Gaea's Cradle help ramp up into powerful threats quickly. The mana base includes a variety of lands to support the deck's multicolor requirements and utility lands like Wasteland for disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly establish board presence with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Stoneforge Mystic while disrupting the opponent's game plan with countermagic and removal spells. The deck aims to control the tempo of the game through using efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Swords to Plowshares to keep the opponent's threats in check, while also having the ability to quickly close out the game with powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull. The deck thrives on efficiency and applying pressure early in the game to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing board presence and disrupting the opponent's strategy with a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, along with efficient removal like Abrupt Decay. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to control the game and generate card advantage. The presence of efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Shardless Agent, along with the powerful utility of Deathrite Shaman, helps to apply pressure and close out games quickly. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to the deck's spells and support its multicolor strategy.

The deck focuses on cheating powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play quickly using cards like Sneak Attack and Show and Tell. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with these massive threats before they have a chance to respond. The deck also includes a variety of cantrips and counterspells to help find and protect the combo pieces. Cards like Omniscience allow for even more explosive plays, making it a high-risk, high-reward strategy that can lead to quick victories.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and disruptive elements like Stifle and Wasteland, while utilizing Stoneforge Mystic to search for powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte. True-Name Nemesis and Vendilion Clique provide additional threats and disruption, with Snapcaster Mage and Dig Through Time offering card advantage. The deck also includes burn spells like Lightning Bolt for additional removal or reach. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the control elements and enable the powerful spells in the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble a combo using cards like Dark Ritual, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Infernal Tutor to generate mana and find key pieces such as Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam. Card selection and disruption tools like Gitaxian Probe, Duress, Preordain, and Cabal Therapy are used to protect the combo and disrupt opponents. Past in Flames allows for additional casting of spells from the graveyard, while Brainstorm and Ponder provide card selection to find the right pieces. The goal is to create a critical mass of spells to finish off the opponent with a high storm count.

This deck focuses on playing aggressively with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and True-Name Nemesis, backed up by disruption spells like Stifle, Force of Will, and Spell Pierce. It aims to control the game through countering opponents' spells and disrupting their mana base with cards like Wasteland while closing out games quickly with burn spells like Lightning Bolt. The deck relies on using cheap cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to keep the pressure on opponents and maintain card advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy threats like Young Pyromancer and Delver of Secrets while disrupting the opponent with counterspells and removal spells like Force of Will and Lightning Bolt. It aims to maintain tempo by utilizing cards like Daze and Stifle to slow down the opponent and protect its own creatures. The deck also has some hand disruption in the form of Thoughtseize to further disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategy with a mix of dual lands and fetchlands.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly play aggressive creatures such as Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Monastery Swiftspear while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also includes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Forked Bolt to deal direct damage to the opponent. The blue cards in the deck help with card selection and digging through the deck for more threats, allowing the player to maintain pressure on the opponent while protecting their own creatures.

The main concept of this Legacy UR Aggro deck is to aggressively control the board and disrupt the opponent's gameplay using cheap and efficient spells like Lightning Bolt, Delver of Secrets, and Young Pyromancer. The deck focuses on tempo advantage through cards like Daze and Force of Will to counter threats while building up a board presence with token generation from Young Pyromancer. By combining powerful card draw with card selection, the deck aims to quickly close out the game with burn spells and efficient creatures before the opponent can establish their own game plan.
